data.citation: Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). The Dance Hall in Arles, October–November 1888. Oil on canvas; 65 × 80.5 cm (25 5/8 × 31 11/16 in.). Musée d’Orsay, Paris, RF 1950 9.
Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). A Pair of Leather Clogs, 1888. Oil on canvas; 32.5 × 40.5 cm (12 13/16 × 15 15/16 in.). Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam.
Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Prawns and Mussels, September–November 1886. Oil on canvas; 26.5 × 34.8 cm (10 5/8 × 13 3/8 in.). Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam, S 122 V/1962.

data.ctitle: 414 Vincent van Gogh, The big olive tree
data.citation: Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Olive Orchard or The Olive Plantation, 1889. Oil on canvas; 53.5 × 64.5 cm (21 × 25 3/8 in.). Private collection.
Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). The Mill of Montmartre, 1886. Oil on canvas. 46.5 × 38 cm. Destroyed.

Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890), Mountains at Saint-Rémy, July 1889. Oil on canvas; 71.8 × 90.8 cm (28 1/4 × 35 3/4 in.). Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, New York,Thannhauser Collection, gift, Justin K. Thannhauser 78.2514.24.

Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Olive Trees, 1889. Oil on canvas; 72.7 × 92.1 cm (28 5/8 × 36 1/4 in.). The Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Walter H. and Leonore Annenberg Collection, gift of Walter H. and Leonore Annenberg, 1998, bequest of Walter H. Annenberg, 2002, 1998.325.1.

data.ctitle: 422 Vincent van Gogh, Self-portrait (Lent by John Quinn)
data.citation: Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Self-Portrait, Summer 1887. Oil on canvas; 41 × 33.5 cm (16 1/8 × 13 3/16 in.). Wadsworth Atheneum, Hartford, Connecticut.

data.ctitle: 423 Vincent van Gogh, Head and Shoulders of Young Woman
data.citation: Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Adeline Ravoux, 1890. Oil on canvas; 50.2 × 50.5 cm (19 3/4 × 19 7/8 in.). Cleveland Museum of Art, bequest of Leonard C. Hanna, Jr., 1958.31.
Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890), Undergrowth With Two Figures, June 1890. Oil on canvas; 49.5 × 99.7 cm (19 1/2 × 39 1/4 in.). Cincinnati Art Museum, bequest of Mary E. Johnston, 1967.1430.
Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Landscape with Figures, 1889. Oil on canvas; 73 × 92.1 cm (28 3/4 × 36 1/4 in.). The Baltimore Museum of Art, The Cone Collection, 1950.303.
Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). Vase with Poppies, Summer 1886. Oil on canvas; 56 × 46 cm (22 × 18 1/8 in.). Wadsworth Atheneum, Hartford, Connecticut.

data.ctitle: 410 Vincent van Gogh, The Zouave (Lent by M. E. Druet)
data.citation: Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890). The Zouave, c. June 20, 1888. Reed pen and brown ink, wax crayon and watercolor, over graphite, on wove paper; 31.5 × 23.6 cm (12 3/8 × 9 5/16 in.). The Metropolitan Museum of Art, gift of Emanie Philips, 1962, 62.151.
Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). Portrait of Gustave Boyer, c. 1870 . Oil on canvas; 60 × 44 cm (23 5/8 × 17 3/8 in.).

data.ctitle: 48 Paul Cezanne, Harvesters (Lent by J. O. Summer)
data.citation: Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). The Harvesters, c. 1877. Oil on canvas; 26 × 41 cm (10 1/4 × 16 1/8 in.). Private collection.
Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). Jas de Bouffan, c. 1879. Oil on canvas; 60 × 73 cm (23 5/8 × 28 3/4 in.). Nasjonalgalleriet, Oslo, gift of Tryggve Sagen.
Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). The Road, c. 1871. Oil on canvas; 58.4 × 71.1 cm (23 × 28 in.). Private collection.
Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). Self Portrait with Bowler Hat, c. 1885. Oil on canvas; 44.5 × 35.5 cm (17 1/2 × 14 in.). Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek, Copenhagen, MIN 1892.
Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). An Old Woman with a Rosary, 1895/96. Oil on canvas; 80.6 × 65.5 cm (31 3/4 × 25 3/4 in.). The National Gallery, London, NG6195.
Paul Cézanne (French, 1839–1906). Portrait of Madame Cézanne, c. 1885. Oil on canvas; 46 × 38.1 cm (18 1/8 × 15 in.). Private collection.
